business.headline: Nvidia to invest $100 billion in OpenAI for next-gen AI infrastructureThe companies unveiled a letter of intent for a landmark strategic partnership to deploy at least 10 gigawatts of Nvidia chips for OpenAI's AI infrastructure.

Why Noida is emerging as India's next hotspot for branded residencesNoida is shedding its image as just a satellite city of Delhi. With luxury developers entering the market, it's fast becoming India's go-to destination for branded residences that promise prestige, comfort, and modern living.

IndusInd Bank's ex-CFO records statement in accounting lapse probeMumbai Police's Economic Offences Wing (EOW) has so far recorded statements of seven to eight employees of the bank. Ex-CFO Gobind Jain recorded his statement today.

Income tax refund claim rejected? CA explains how to rectify and reapplyGetting your income tax refund rejected can be unsettling, especially after filing on time. But in most cases, the issues are minor and fixable. Here's a look at why rejections occur and how to reapply successfully.

Gold, silver or equity: Where should you invest right now?Gold prices touched a fresh record high on the 1st day of Navrartri, once again sparking the age-old debate among investors: where should money be parked during this time, gold, silver, or equity?

Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw discusses GST, MSME benefits, key reformsUnion Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw held a press conference, detailing the benefits of GST reform. The Minister explained how GST advantages extend to all states, estimating a saving of Rs 3,500 for a middle-class family.

Sensex falls over 450 points, Nifty settles lower as IT stocks tumbleThe sell-off was led by information technology stocks, which tumbled nearly 2% after President Donald Trump announced a $100,000 fee for new H-1B visa applications.

Sensex tumbles 500 points: Why is the stock market falling todayThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 503.31 points at 82,122.92 by 2:55 pm, while the NSE Nifty50 slipped 143.80 points to 25,183.20. Volatility surged across broader market segments, with most indices in the red.

IT sector faces H-1B visa jitters: Should you keep your money parked or sell?Recent changes to the H-1B visa programme have triggered new worries for Indian IT companies, already facing weaker client demand.

Turning 50? Here's how to protect your retirement savings, explains financial advisorHitting 50 can be a mix of pride and worry, especially when it comes to money. Even after years of saving and investing, many fear their retirement funds may not last as long as planned. Here are expert tips to safeguard your savings.

Errors in ITR filing? 3 simple ways to fix it: Revise, rectify or updateWorried about spotting a mistake in your ITR after filing? You're not alone. Errors happen to many taxpayers. Thankfully, the system gives you not one but three ways to fix them. Let's have a look.

Should you still bet on IT stocks as H-1B visa worries resurface?The US move on H-1B visa has stirred fears of rising costs and tighter restrictions on tech firms that rely on sending skilled workers to client locations.

entertainment.headline: BTS' company HYBE officially launches Indian subsidiary HYBE IndiaHYBE has inaugurated its Indian subsidiary, HYBE India Entertainment Private Limited, establishing Mumbai as its strategic hub to connect the Indian music market with the global ecosystem.

Rasha Thadani and Abhay Verma give BTS glimpses from Laikey Laikaa sets. PicsRasha Thadani and Abhay Verma shared playful behind-the-scenes moments from their upcoming romantic-action film 'Laikey Laikaa', slated for a 2026 release.

Soha Ali Khan shares producers once asked Rang De Basanti cast to return moneySoha Ali Khan shared that the producers of 'Rang De Basanti' once asked the cast to return part of their pay, unsure of the film's success.

Parag Tyagi remembers Shefali, shares details of her final moments: It slipped awayParag Tyagi, husband of late actor Shefali Jariwala, has launched a YouTube channel in her memory, where he shared emotional details about her final moments and unfulfilled dreams.

Sonam Kapoor shares update on her disruptive Bollywood comeback after motherhoodSonam Kapoor is set to return to films after spending the past few years focusing on motherhood and family life following the birth of her son, Vayu. She plans to choose projects with strong, layered female roles that resonate with her vision and tell meaningful stories.

I no longer recognise my country: Angelina Jolie over free speech concernAngelina Jolie expressed deep concern over the erosion of free speech in the United States while presenting her latest film at Spain's San Sebastián festival.

Rise & Fall: Kubbra Sait picked over Aarush Bhola to become rulerActor Kubbra Sait became the latest contestant to transition from being a worker to a ruler in the latest episode of 'Rise & Fall.' The decision followed a key vote amongst the rulers, who were confused between Kubrra and Aarush Bhola.

Zubeen Garg's second post-mortem on Tuesday after public demand: Assam CMAssam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma announced a fresh autopsy for singer Zubeen Garg amid ongoing investigations into his death, with the post-mortem scheduled at Guwahati Medical College.

Why Ranbir Kapoor's cameo in The Ba***s of Bollywood has created controversyActor Ranbir Kapoor's brief cameo in Aryan Khan's Netflix series 'The Ba***s of Bollywood' has drawn the attention of the Human Rights Commission over a vape scene. Here's what happens in the scene and if it matters.

Riddhima welcomes Dilip with garland, Farah says he's demanding higher salaryRiddhima Kapoor Sahni recently welcomed Farah Khan and her cook Dilip with garlands at her Delhi home. During their interaction, the filmmaker joked about Dilip demanding a higher salary after gaining widespread attention.

71st National Film Awards: When and where to watch the ceremony liveThe 71st National Film Awards will take place on September 23 in New Delhi. The awardees will be honoured by President Droupadi Murmu.

Zubeen Garg's voice to be digitally preserved to prevent AI misuseZubeen Garg's voice will be digitally preserved to safeguard it from AI misuse and unauthorised tampering. His close associate, Manas Robin, said a unique 'digital signature' will be created to ensure the authenticity of his vocals.

Fatima Sana Shaikh not in The Wives, Madhur Bhandarkar clears the airMadhur Bhandarkar has completed filming 'The Wives', clarifying that Fatima Sana Shaikh was never part of the cast despite rumours. The film stars Regina Cassandra, Sonali Kulkarni and Mouni Roy.

Court summons Malayalam actor Unni Mukundan in manager assault caseMalayalam actor Unni Mukundan has been summoned by the Kakkanad Magistrate's Court in an assault case filed by his former manager Vipin Kumar. The 'Marco' star earlier denied all allegations, calling them false and insisting Kumar was never his manager.

Adhira first look out: Kalyan Dasari faces SJ Suryah in superhero multiverseThe first-look poster for Prasanth Varma's 'Adhira' was launched among high anticipation. SJ Suryah and Kalyan Dasari feature in the lead roles in the film.

How Aryan Khan turns privilege into power with The Ba***ds of BollywoodAryan Khan's Netflix debut 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood' turns nepotism on its head, blending insider access, satire, and self-trolls into a guilty pleasure only an SRK heir could pull off.

Bigg Boss 19: Awez Darbar's viral 'chai bana' moment gets a hilarious remixAwez Darbar's humorous 'chai bana aur sabko pila' moment from 'Bigg Boss' went viral after music producer Zaynul Jiwani turned it into a funny Instagram reel. Fans and even Awez's sister, Anam Darbar, reacted, making the clip one of the most talked-about moments from the show.

Marisa Abela on voicing Lizzie in Pride and Prejudice audiobook, love for Indian filmsMarisa Abela has voiced Elizabeth Bennet in Audible's latest 'Pride and Prejudice' adaptation. Her passion for the role and love for Indian cinema shine through in this exclusive interview.

Amitabh Bachchan wins hearts by gifting umbrellas, helmets to fans at JalsaAmitabh Bachchan continued his Sunday ritual at Jalsa by greeting fans and surprising them with gifts like umbrellas and helmets.

general news.headline: India is critical to US, Rubio says after Jaishankar meet amid H-1B visa rowUS Secretary of State Marco Rubio and External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar reaffirmed ties in New York after Trump's USD 100,000 H-1B visa fee rattled India's tech industry and reignited trade tensions.

US may exempt doctors from $100,000 H-1B visa fee: ReportThe H-1B visa programme is seen as critical for hospitals that depend on foreign-trained doctors to work in remote regions. Several health systems rely on visas to bring in medical residents and specialists to serve areas that struggle to attract US-trained professionals.

Jimmy Kimmel's show returns after suspension over Charlie Kirk remarksDisney says "Jimmy Kimmel Live!" will return on Tuesday after a brief pause. The network said last week's decision was meant to calm tensions, calling some comments ill-timed and insensitive.

Zubeen Garg's second post-mortem on Tuesday after public demand: Assam CMAssam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma announced a fresh autopsy for singer Zubeen Garg amid ongoing investigations into his death, with the post-mortem scheduled at Guwahati Medical College.

How Pakistan brought mujahid mentality to the cricket pitchPakistani cricketers' provocative gestures, like Sahibzada Farhan's AK-47 gunfire mimicry and Haris Rauf's plane-shooting taunt, have exposed their "mujahid" mentality. Their antics, seen as militant symbolism on the pitch, have exposed the jihad rot that has percolated every strata of Pakistani society. It has bolstered the case for a boycott of the Pakistani team.

PSG's Ousmane Dembele beats Lamine Yamal to win his first Ballon d'Or trophyParis Saint-Germain's Ousmane Dembele lifted his first Ballon d'Or award on Monday, September 22 in Paris. The Champions League winner beat Barcelona's Lamine Yamal to finally deliver on the promise of his legacy.

13-year-old Afghan boy hides in plane's landing gear for 2 hours, lands in DelhiThe boy was apprehended by the airline personnel and handed over to the Central Industrial Security Force personnel, who brought him to Terminal 3 of the airport for questioning.

3,371 Indians in Stanford list of top 2% scientists of 2025, IISc and IITs leadThe Stanford/Elsevier Top 2% list names 3,371 Indian researchers in 2025. IISc and key IITs lead the national tally, covering career-long and single-year citation impact measured by Scopus and c-score.

A phenomenon called Zubeen Garg and how Mayabini became an anthemAssam has been plunged into an unprecedented mourning after Zubeen Garg's death, with lakhs singing and humming Zubeen's song 'Mayabini Ratir Bukut' into a collective anthem of grief. From Guwahati to cities across India, the outpouring has revealed the true scale of Zubeen Da's cultural and emotional enigma in his fans.

Sanjeev Sanyal says judicial system biggest hurdle to Viksit Bharat aimSanjeev Sanyal, member of the Prime Minister's Economic Advisory Council (EAC), warned that India's legal and judicial ecosystem is the principal obstacle to the country's ambition of becoming a "Viksit Bharat."
ULIPs & Mutual Funds: Why you need both for a balanced portfolioULIPs give you protection and discipline for the long haul, while mutual funds give you liquidity and flexibility for the near term.

France recognises Palestinian statehood at UN, Macron calls it a historic step France formally recognised Palestine at the UN, with Macron declaring statehood a "historic commitment to peace." The move, applauded by world leaders, comes as Israel's Gaza war and West Bank settlements continue.

H1B visa row: The end of the American dream? | From the archives (2025)As India grapples with the Trump administration's H1B visa fee spike, we analyse another setback: barriers for foreign students seeking education in the US

What is 'I Love Muhammad' row and why did it spark protests across India?The 'I Love Muhammad' slogan, first contested during a Barawafat procession in Kanpur, has triggered protests and processions by Muslims across several states. Clashes with police, FIRs, and social media debates have intensified the controversy, drawing attention from political leaders and religious organisations.

Israeli exit, Arab troops, no Hamas: Trump to present Gaza peace planPresident Trump will present Arab leaders with a US proposal to end the Gaza war, pushing for Israeli withdrawal, post-war governance without Hamas, Arab peacekeepers, and regional funding for reconstruction.

Ex-banker duped of Rs 23 crore, held in digital arrest for 47 days in his Delhi homeCybercriminals posed as officials and kept the retired banker under 'digital arrest' for over a month, warning him not to speak to anyone and claiming he was under 24/7 surveillance.

Pant out, selectors mull over Karun's spot in home series vs Windies: ReportRishabh Pant is likely to miss India's first home Test series of the season. Pant, who is still recovering from his foot fracture, is yet to receive a clearance from the BCCI medical board.

Denmark's Copenhagen airport reopens after nearly four-hour drone disruptionCopenhagen Airport reopened Tuesday after nearly four hours of closure due to drone sightings. About 50 flights were diverted, with delays and cancellations expected as authorities continue investigating the incident.

Not good: Trump says Tylenol painkiller use in pregnancy linked to autismTrump claimed Tylenol use in pregnancy may cause autism, echoing theories promoted by Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. Experts strongly dispute the claim, warning it ignores science and risks fueling misinformation.

Nvidia to invest $100 billion in OpenAI for next-gen AI infrastructureThe companies unveiled a letter of intent for a landmark strategic partnership to deploy at least 10 gigawatts of Nvidia chips for OpenAI's AI infrastructure.

Russia offers to abide by expiring nuclear treaty for 1 year, US says sounds goodPutin said an extension would serve the interests of global non-proliferation and open the door for talks with Washington on a potential successor agreement.

Sourav Ganguly returns as CAB president after 6 years, replaces brotherFormer India captain Sourav Ganguly was re-elected as president of the Cricket Association of Bengal (CAB) on Monday, marking his return after a six-year gap. He replaced his brother Snehashish.

Oracle to oversee TikTok security for American users, White House saysOracle will oversee TikTok's algorithm security under a US divestment deal, easing national security concerns as ByteDance prepares to cede control. Trump is set to certify the plan this week.

sports.headline: Ballon d'Or 2025: Full list of winners in ParisOusmane Dembele and Aitana Bonmati were named the best players at the 2025 Ballon d'Or ceremony in Paris. Here are the full list of winners from the ceremony.

Sourav Ganguly returns as CAB president after 6 years, replaces brotherFormer India captain Sourav Ganguly was re-elected as president of the Cricket Association of Bengal (CAB) on Monday, marking his return after a six-year gap. He replaced his brother Snehashish.

Shall India continue playing against Pakistan after provocative gestures?Asia Cup 2025: Sahibzada Farhan's gunshot celebration and Haris Rauf's fighter jet gesture in the Super 4 clash on Sunday in Dubai have raised questions on whether India should continue playing against Pakistan.

Country declares public holiday to celebrate World Athletics Championships goldBotswana has declared a public holiday to celebrate its men's 4x400m relay gold at the World Athletics Championships. The victory marks a historic first for Africa.

Pant out, selectors mull over Karun's spot in home series vs Windies: ReportRishabh Pant is likely to miss India's first home Test series of the season. Pant, who is still recovering from his foot fracture, is yet to receive a clearance from the BCCI medical board.

England fast bowler announces retirement at 29 to become a solicitorEngland fast bowler Freya Davies has retired from professional cricket at 29. She will now pursue a career in law as a trainee solicitor, marking a new chapter after a notable cricket career.

Sri Lanka not worried about toss factor in Pakistan clash: Charith AsalankaAsia Cup, PAK vs SL: Charith Asalanka said Sri Lanka aren't worried about the toss ahead of their Super 4 clash against Pakistan, despite their first loss batting first to Bangladesh, led by Litton Das.

Pathan not surprised by Rauf's antics: Pakistan do far worse behind the scenesFormer India cricketer Irfan Pathan has slammed Pakistan's Haris Rauf and Sahibzada Farhan for their provocative gestures in their Asia Cup match against India. Speaking on his YouTube channel, Pathan also took a dig at Shahid Afridi.

Sahibzada Farhan wants Pakistan to solve middle-order woes in Sri Lanka clashAsia Cup 2025: Sahibzada Farhan said that Pakistan need to solve their issues with the middle-order in their do-or-die clash against Sri Lanka on Tuesday, September 23 at the Sheikh Zayed Stadium in Abu Dhabi.

Before Women's World Cup, Pakistan spinner warms up with historic ODI spellNashra Sandhu made history by becoming the first left-arm Asian spinner to take a six-wicket haul in a Women's ODI, claiming 6-26 in 9 overs against South Africa at Lahore on September 22.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
